defects.description: Main content element has inconsistent indentation (extra 10-space indent) compared to surrounding sibling elements, suggesting a misaligned layout structure that could produce unintended nesting or sp
PageLoader uses a hardcoded light-only gradient background (from-charcoal-50 to-white) with no dark: variant, causing a bright flash when lazy-loaded pages render in dark mode

HomePage uses light-only gradient (from-charcoal-50 to-white) at line 87, and the Quick Tips section at line 474 has a hardcoded bg-white inner container. Additionally, all stat cards and quick action

Toast notifications use hardcoded inline styles for typography (fontSize: '14px', fontWeight: '500') and colors (background: '#1e293b', color: '#f8fafc') instead of design system tokens or Tailwind cl
defects.skip_reason: Toast uses inline styles — react-hot-toast library constraint
defects.fix_approach: Library limitation; Tailwind refactor has no benefit

defects.description: Shared audit view route (/audit/shared/:shareId) breaks the /app prefix convention used by all other authenticated-context routes. It sits outside both the /app/* and public route namespaces, creating
defects.skip_reason: Route naming follows component directory structure

defects.description: The public /accessibility route maps to AccessibilityStatement (legal page), while the authenticated /app/accessibility route maps to the Accessibility Audit tool. The identical path segment 'accessib
defects.skip_reason: Accessibility naming collision — clear in context
defects.fix_approach: URLs match directory structure by design

defects.description: Route /app/planner/projects/:projectId renders SEOChecklist component, but the toolName in the error boundary is 'Content Checklist'. The route path says 'planner/projects', the component name says 'S
PageLoader spinner (Suspense fallback) has no aria-live region or role='status' to announce loading state to screen readers

No sitemap.xml file exists anywhere in the project. The application has 15+ public routes (/, /about, /features, /features/:slug, /help, /help/getting-started, /help/resources, /help/glossary, /terms,
defects.fix_approach: Add build-time sitemap generation from route config

defects.description: Seven public marketing pages (LandingPage, AboutPage, FeaturesPage, FeatureDetailPage, HelpCenterPage, GettingStartedPage, NotFoundPage) are eagerly imported in App.jsx (lines 25-31). These are loaded
Unused state variables _showPreview and _setShowPreview declared with eslint-disable. The Preview button at line 427-429 has no onClick handler, making it non-functional.
Summary stats use grid-cols-5 without responsive breakpoints, causing five columns to compress into unreadable widths on mobile viewports
The subtitle says 'WCAG 2.1' while the PDF export title on line 179 says 'WCAG 2.2' and the rest of the app consistently uses 'WCAG 2.2'. The VPAT header subtitle contradicts the export content.
The summary stat label 'Does Not' is truncated from 'Does Not Support'. Other labels are either full text or recognizable abbreviations like 'N/A', but 'Does Not' is incomplete and confusing.
The close button (X icon) in the VPAT Report Generator header lacks an aria-label attribute, making it inaccessible to screen readers.

The VPAT Report Generator renders all 55+ WCAG criteria in a single scrollable list with all 4 principle sections expanded by default (line 101). Each criterion has a conformance dropdown and a remark

The header subtitle says 'WCAG 2.1' but the criteria list includes WCAG 2.2 criteria (lines 86-95), and the export PDF title says 'WCAG 2.2 Conformance Report' (line 179). Mixed version labeling withi
Close button (X icon) in VPATReportGenerator header has no aria-label; screen reader users cannot identify its purpose
Conformance <select> dropdowns and remarks <textarea> elements have no associated <label> or aria-label; only a sibling heading provides visual context

The toggleSchedule function reads from the stale `schedules` state variable to find the schedule and display the toast message. Because setSchedules is called before the toast, the toast reads the old
ScheduledReportsPanel uses dynamic Tailwind class construction (template literals for bg-${color}-100, text-${color}-600, etc.) which will fail with Tailwind's JIT compiler since the full class names

The Image Alt Text Audit report type includes an 'includeAIsuggestions' configuration field (line 79) that enables AI-generated alt text suggestions in automated scheduled reports. These AI suggestion

The ScheduledReportsPanel stores all schedule data in local React state only. The TODO comment on line 154 ('TODO: Load scheduled reports from Firestore') confirms that scheduled reports are never per
defects.skip_reason: ScheduledReportsPanel local state only — never persisted
defects.fix_approach: Migrate to Firestore; add onSnapshot for real-time sync

defects.description: The scheduled report form accepts comma-separated recipient emails (line 661) but performs no email format validation. The handleSubmit function (line 645) only checks that the recipients field is not
The recipients field in the ScheduleFormModal accepts comma-separated email addresses as free text (line 930) but performs no email format validation. The handleSubmit function (line 645) only checks

The ScheduleFormModal has a multi-step form (3 steps) but the Continue button (line 1002-1009) does not validate the current step before advancing. On Step 1, users can proceed without entering a sche

The ScheduledReportsPanel component uses only local React state (useState) to manage all scheduled reports, with a TODO comment on line 154-155 stating 'Load scheduled reports from Firestore / Reports
defects.fix_approach: Implement Firestore persistence; add status tracking
